data.fullContent: There have also been many recent constitutional developments in the nation. The office of Prime Minister increased greatly in power under the Conservative Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher ( the `` Iron Lady '' ) and the Labour Prime Minister Tony Blair. Under Blair, many of Parliament's lawmaking functions were devolved to local administrations in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. In 1999, the House of Lords Act was passed, removing the automatic right of hereditary peers to sit in the House.
data.answer: 这个国家最近还出现了许多宪法发展。在保守党首相玛格丽特·撒切尔(“铁娘子”)和工党首相托尼·布莱尔的领导下，首相的权力大大增加。在布莱尔的领导下，许多议会的立法职能被移交给苏格兰、威尔士和北爱尔兰的地方政府。1999年，上议院法案通过，取消了世袭贵族自动进入众议院的权利。
